speaker: JANE BRODY
line: Cover for me in case dork-face comes back around, will you?

speaker: MISSY
line: Where you going?

speaker: JANE BRODY
line: I need a cigarette.

speaker: MISSY
line: You had one 15 minutes ago.

speaker: JANE BRODY
line: 45 minutes.

speaker: MISSY
line: Why don't you get yourself one of those patches or that gum?

speaker: JANE BRODY
line: What do you think I'm chewing?

speaker: MISSY
line: Then maybe you should just quit. Ever think of that?

speaker: JANE BRODY
line: Look. Just cover for me, OK? Tell her I've got a stomach bug or something.

speaker: MISSY
line: Jane! Come on, you're gonna get in trouble! Jane?

speaker: MISSY
line: Hey, Jane...

speaker: AUDREY COUNTY MORGUE, 12
line: 22 AM

speaker: POLICE FORENSIC LAB, DESMOND, VIRGINIA, 2
line: 35 AM

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: Brodie, Jane L. Yeah, we've got the pathologist's work, but the, uh, techs haven't been over the crime scene yet.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let me see what you've got.

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: Your name?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Special Agent Fox Mulder.

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: Working the late shift, Agent Mulder?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah. Somebody's got to.

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: You need to sign that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm all set here.

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: Finished?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah. Thanks.

speaker: OFFICER ROBBINS
line: No problem.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: Agent Mulder! I'm glad I caught you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who are you?

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: Detective Thomas. Ray Thomas. I'm the one who contacted you, who e-mailed the pictures to your office. I ran into Officer Robbins. He said you'd come down here to take a look at some of the forensic evidence.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, that's right.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: So... does that mean you think you found something here, something worth looking into?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm afraid not.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: No?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't find anything to recommend my further involvement in this case.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: What about the woman? How do you explain what happened to her? She walks into a bathroom, a minute later, she turns up... You saw the pictures!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I saw them.

speaker: DETECTIVE THOMAS
line: I was told you were part of something called the X-Files, you'd look into stuff like this. So if there's really nothing to this, why come all the way down here in the middle of the night?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm just doing my job, Detective, same as you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you are home.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, what are you doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was trying to reach you. I think your phone's off the hook.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh, I needed some sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that why you're taking the garbage out at 4 in the morning?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I want some answers.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Concerning?

speaker: MULDER
line: The unexplained death of a postal worker that somebody is apparently going to great lengths to keep unexplained. These photos were sent to me by a detective who thought I might have a fresh take on the case, but when I went to retrieve them from my e-mail, somebody had hollowed out the files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then where'd you get them?

speaker: MULDER
line: From his partner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: When?

speaker: MULDER
line: After he finished questioning me about the detective's death.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What, what are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: He was killed, shot in the head execution-style. His body was found near the precinct two hours ago... possibly by the same person who forged my name to gain access to evidence from the forensics lab.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What do you want from me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I'd like your help on this, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What about Agent Scully?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully is in the hospital.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Has something happened that I should know about?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's undergoing some imaging tests. Her, uh, her oncologist was concerned about some microscopy results that, uh, her tumor may be metastasizing. Anyway, I, I'd like you to take a look at those photos, please.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yeah, I will, first thing in the morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Want me to, uh, dump this on my way out?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Was it you? Did you pull the trigger, or did you have him do it for you?

speaker: CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN (CSM)
line: I'm not here to answer your questions.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You murdered him! You killed an officer of the law!

speaker: CSM
line: I suggest you keep your voice down, Mr. Skinner, unless you want your neighbors to know the hours and the company you keep.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I won't be a party to murder.

speaker: CSM
line: I wouldn't get too comfortable on your moral high ground, Mr. Skinner. This only happened because you left your job unfinished.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I handled him just like I've handled everything else you've asked me to do. I followed your instructions.

speaker: CSM
line: You failed to neutralize a potentially compromising situation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You didn't have to kill him. He didn't have to die.

speaker: CSM
line: You're in no position to question the terms of our arrangement.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then we have no arrangement.

speaker: CSM
line: You'll find it's not that easy to walk away from, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No?

speaker: CSM
line: A man digs a hole, he risks falling into it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her body's gone, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: The postal worker in the photos that I gave you. Her body was stolen from the morgue last night, along with any other evidence that might explain how or why she died.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Slow down, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, but I can't. I'm playing catch-up here, and I'm already two steps behind. The man who impersonated me at the forensics lab last night, apparently he replaced a blood sample.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: I had them run a test. The blood sample in the police forensics lab is B-positive, as is the postal worker's, but she suffered from a mild form of anemia characterized by a folic acid deficiency. The blood sample at the police forensics lab has a normal folate serum level.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are there any suspects?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but I do have a place to start. The gun that killed Detective Thomas - ballistics has identified it as a Sig-Sauer P228. I'm having ballistics run comps on all weapons registered to federal agents and, uh, local officers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let me know what they find.

speaker: MULDER
line: I will.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can't do this!

speaker: CSM
line: You sound agitated, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Was it my gun?

speaker: CSM
line: Your gun?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Used to kill the detective?

speaker: CSM
line: Well, if it was, I'd think you'd want to report it to the police immediately.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Oh, don't think that I won't.

speaker: CSM
line: Then why are you calling me? Perhaps because you realize that you'd be admitting to the obstruction of justice, criminal conspiracy, and destruction of evidence? The consequences could be very serious for you, even in the unlikely event that you were able to persuade the authorities that you didn't kill the detective.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What did you have me cover up?

speaker: CSM
line: I think the less you know the better, under the circumstances.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need to know what that man died for.

speaker: CSM
line: He died for you, Mr. Skinner. He died so you could have what you wanted - a cure for Agent Scully. Isn't that what you want?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully is in the hospital. If you can do anything for her, I want it done now.

speaker: CSM
line: I'm fully aware of Agent Scully's progress.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If anything happens to her, I will expose you. I'll turn state's evidence. I don't care what happens to me.

speaker: CSM
line: Agent Scully stands to live a long and healthy life. I would hope the same for you, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SUPERVISOR
line: Police said we could put the bathroom back in service. But the truth is, no one wants to use it. Not after what happened yesterday. You mind my asking what you're looking for?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need a hammer.

speaker: ELSINORE, MARYLAND, 1
line: 15 PM

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Is there any reason you're not running this through the FBI lab?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh, this evidence is classified. We've had some controversy over security at the Bureau. I'd appreciate your discretion.

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Oh, certainly.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you tell what kind of bees made that?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Uh, it's hard to tell with just the comb, but I might be able to give you an answer.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If I told you there was a chance that the bees that made that could be lethal, would that be helpful?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Any kind of bee can be lethal, provided you get stung by enough of them. Even Africanized honey bees, the so-called killer bees, basically have the same venom as the European honey bee. It's just that they tend to attack in swarms. Ah, we may be in luck.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is it?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Royal jelly, a highly nutritious secretion of the honey bees' pharyngeal gland. It's fed to the very young larvae in the colony. Here, see for yourself.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is that gonna hatch?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Once they pupate, I should be able to give you some definitive answers.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The minute you learn something, I'd appreciate a call.

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Is this related to that other case? If you don't mind me asking...

speaker: SKINNER
line: What other case?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: I got a call from another agent about six months ago asking me all about killer bees.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who was it?

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Uh, the name was Fox Mulder. I wonder if there's any connection?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: DR. VALEDESPINO
line: Anyway, I'll call you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir? You looking for me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Uh, I was just writing you a note. Where've you been?

speaker: MULDER
line: First Nations Bank of Virginia.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What am I looking at?

speaker: MULDER
line: The bank is adjacent to the police headquarters where the detective was killed. Their parking lot surveillance camera caught this image. That man there - that's Detective Thomas. This man in the baseball hat - he was identified by the officer on duty at the forensics lab as "Agent Mulder".

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you get a usable image of this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm gonna hand deliver it to Special Photo right now. What did you want to talk to me about? You were writing me a note.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was, uh, I was just checking on your progress.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Miss Covarrubias? This is Walter Skinner. I'm an Assistant Director here at the FBI.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Yes?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was hoping you could help me. I understand Agent Fox Mulder has been in contact with you about a project.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: A project?

speaker: SKINNER
line: A Canadian agricultural project involving bees and bee husbandry.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Yes, but, I wasn't able to give him any information.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why was that?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: The project he cited turned up no viable evidence.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Evidence of what?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Bee hives... or bee husbandry.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What if I told you I had access to that evidence?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: You have access to these bees?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I may, soon. Very soon.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks for getting down here so quickly.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: A break. Maybe even a lead.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wanted you to get a look at this body before somebody tried to steal it. See these pocks and blisters? They're the same as we saw in the photo of the deceased postal worker.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Symptoms of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Smallpox. The first reported case in over seven years.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Smallpox?

speaker: MULDER
line: According to the coroner, an especially virulent strain caused by a mutated variola virus.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Caused how? I mean, how could this man contract a disease that doesn't even exist any more?

speaker: MULDER
line: From these.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are they?

speaker: MULDER
line: Bee stingers and venom sacs recovered subcutaneously from the victim's face, arm and neck.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're saying this man was stung by bees carrying smallpox?

speaker: MULDER
line: He was a forensic entomologist. I consulted with him several months ago about a similar fatality.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then you've seen this before?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but I've never had any hard evidence. Not until now. I think that's what somebody's gone to great lengths to try to prevent.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can only guess. But I think that somebody is trying to engineer a method of delivery... for a disease that has killed more people throughout history than any other contagion known to humankind. If you want me to suggest an appropriate response...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can they be stopped?

speaker: MULDER
line: How can we stop them? We don't even know who these people are, and we won't until we know the identity of that shooter.

speaker: SKINNER
line: How close are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hopefully, very. I've got one of the photo techs pulling an all-nighter on that surveillance video so he can show me something this morning. I told him that you'd authorize the overtime.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm gonna go over there right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Tell me what you find.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Missy Nagata? My name is Walter Skinner.

speaker: MISSY
line: I was just getting up. They only give us a 10-minute break, and my supervisor's pretty strict.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I need to talk to you, Misty. About your co-worker.

speaker: MISSY
line: If this is about what happened to Jane, I already told the police everything I know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Everything?

speaker: MISSY
line: I don't want to lose my job.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're not going to lose anything. I'm asking you to cooperate in a criminal investigation.

speaker: MISSY
line: Jane? What do you mean?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Jane's death may not have been an accident.

speaker: MISSY
line: What? She was my best friend.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: MISSY
line: We worked it out so that our vacations overlapped. We were going to Palm Beach. Both of us were trying to lose weight so we could buy new bathing suits. The men who came here - they said if I talked to anyone, I'd lose my job.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Did these men say who they were?

speaker: MISSY
line: No, and I didn't ask. They just wanted the package.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What package?

speaker: MISSY
line: Damaged packages are routed here for inspection before they get reshipped.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The place where the damaged packages are kept - how close is it to the restroom where you found Jane?

speaker: MISSY
line: It's just the next door down the hall. They've got a storage room.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The damaged package that they wanted - do you remember where it would be sent?

speaker: MISSY
line: No, not off-hand.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is there any way of finding out?

speaker: MISSY
line: I can look up the tracking number.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That would be a big help to me, Misty. And maybe to Jane.

speaker: PHOTO TECH
line: We went through every inch of that tape to find the best angle for identification purposes. Now remember it was videotape, shot at a distance under extreme low light.

speaker: MULDER
line: So this is the best you can do?

speaker: PHOTO TECH
line: It's better than I thought it would be, believe me. I tried every trick that...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not trying to be difficult. It's just this is very important to me. I need to be sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need you to print out a hardcopy of that for me.

speaker: CSM
line: This is the last remaining specimen. The bees from the scientist's house - it's been contained and destroyed.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: And the body?

speaker: CSM
line: It also has been sanitized.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: How did this happen?

speaker: CSM
line: It's been taken care of. The details are unimportant.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Details are everything. Much more important than your vague assurances.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, you'll have to trust my assurance that any other breaches have been handled.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Handled by whom?

speaker: CSM
line: I have a man in place. A man with no other choice but to succeed.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: What assurance can you give us that he can be trusted?

speaker: 2ND ELDER
line: We can't risk even the slightest exposure.

speaker: CSM
line: He has nothing to expose... except his own duplicity.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Should we assume that the trial run is proceeding as planned?

speaker: CSM
line: It's already begun.

speaker: DAVID
line: Hey, it's my turn!

speaker: BILLY
line: No, it isn't! Ow. Ow.

speaker: DAVID
line: Ms. Kemper! Billy got stung by a bee!

speaker: YOUNG GIRL
line: Ms. Kemper!

speaker: MS. KEMPER
line: Everyone get inside! Everyone inside! Move it! Move it! Come on!

speaker: MS. KEMPER
line: Oh, my God! David!

speaker: MS. KEMPER
line: Quick! Run!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Linzer? My name's Walter Skinner. The administration office informed me you were overseeing the treatment of these children.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: Yes.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think you'll want to hear me out.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: I'm right in the middle of it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've been treating these children for bee stings. You've misdiagnosed them.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: Then what should I be treating them for?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Smallpox.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: Is this a joke?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Every child in this town who hasn't already been infected needs to be vaccinated immediately.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: We don't vaccinate kids against smallpox any more because there is no smallpox.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Run whatever tests you need if you don't believe me.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: I don't need to run any tests. Smallpox has an 8-day incubation period, and these kids were stung just a few hours ago. How do you reconcile that?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't.

speaker: DR. LINZER
line: Let me know when you come up with an answer. In the meantime, I've got things to do.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Doctor...

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Mr. Skinner?

speaker: SKINNER
line: How do you know who I am?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Because you contacted me. I'm Marita Covarrubias.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Your call about those bees prompted me to make some inquiries.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Into what?

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Seven packages that were sent from Canada to a PO box in Peyson, South Carolina. I came here to find out what was in those packages.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're a little late to do anything about it.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: So are you, apparently. What brought you here? You came to me for information, Mr. Skinner, but you still haven't told me what you know about this. My office has to answer to the Secretary General of the United Nations. This is a very serious matter. I need to know what's going on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I think it's some kind of experiment.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: An experiment?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Using bees as carriers.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: That's what was in those packages?... Have you told Agent Mulder this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Not yet.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Why not?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I can't.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Why? Are you involved in this, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't... No, I'm not involved.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: Then what are you doing here? What aren't you telling me, Mr. Skinner?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Nothing.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: If you know who's behind this, you have to come forward, Mr. Skinner. No one else can.

speaker: CRYSTAL CITY, VIRGINIA, 11
line: 02 PM

speaker: MULDER
line: Put the gun down and move away from the desk.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I was just calling...

speaker: MULDER
line: I said put the gun down!

speaker: SKINNER
line: You don't understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I do now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No you don't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that the gun you used to shoot the detective?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's it feel to shoot an innocent man in the head?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't kill that man!

speaker: MULDER
line: You're a liar! You've been working with the Smoking Man all along. You knew when he had my father killed, and you knew when they took Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Listen to me!

speaker: MULDER
line: I've heard enough of you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He set me up! He stole my gun and then he put it back! Which means the police are probably on their way right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look at my desk drawer, Agent Mulder. Look at it! Why would I force my own lock? If I lied to you... I have lied to you, and I won't make excuses for those lies, but there's a reason that I did what I did - one that I think you're in a unique position to understand. I advised you against a certain course of action some time ago... concerning Agent Scully. I didn't follow my own advice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me the gun.

speaker: MULDER
line: How soon will you be able to determine if that's the weapon that killed Detective Thomas?

speaker: BALLISTICS TECH
line: As long as it takes me to put one of these slugs under the scope and run a comp.

speaker: BALLISTICS TECH
line: Now, this is the slug that we recovered from the detective's body. See this stria here and here? They're rifling patterns imprinted from the barrel of the same gun.

speaker: MULDER
line: So this is definitely the murder weapon?

speaker: BALLISTICS TECH
line: If I were called to testify I'd say without a doubt. So where'd you find it?

speaker: MULDER
line: In a sewer grate...... around the corner from the crime scene. Sometimes you get lucky.

speaker: BALLISTICS TECH
line: Sometimes you don't, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: BALLISTICS TECH
line: The serial number - it's been filed clean off. Well, unless forensics pulled a print, this gun is virtually untraceable.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Leave it off. I'm starting to get used to the dark.

speaker: CSM
line: Is this part of our deal?

speaker: SKINNER
line: We never had a deal.

speaker: CSM
line: No?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully is dying, and you haven't done a damn thing about it. You think that's funny?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm just enjoying the irony, Mr. Skinner. Only yesterday, you said you wouldn't be a party to murder and now here you are. Yours isn't the first gun I've had pointed in my face, Mr. Skinner. I'm not afraid to die. But if you kill me now, you'll also kill Agent Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You have no intention of saving her. You never did.

speaker: CSM
line: Are you certain? I saved her life once before, when I had her returned to Agent Mulder. I may save her life again. But you'll never know if you pull the trigger, will you? Now, unless you intend to kill me, I'd like to answer my phone.

speaker: CSM
line: Yes... He was just here. He threatened to kill me. I'm sure Mulder will be contacting you. He'll want to know if Skinner's seen all there is to see.

speaker: MARITA COVARRUBIAS
line: I'll tell him what you want me to tell him.

speaker: CSM
line: Tell him what he wants to hear.
